summary: Box Office: 'Captain Marvel' Is Being Set Up To Fail
title: Box Office: 'Captain Marvel' Is Being Set Up To Fail
excerpt: 'Captain Marvel' need not outgross 'Black Panther' or even 'Wonder Woman' to be a hit.
description:
This is a weird article. The premise is that Captain Marvel will probably not make a billion dollars, like Black Panther and Avengers: Infinity War. It will probably ONLY make $600+ like Ant-Man and the Wasp.

And I agree that judging future superhero movies against the phenomenon that was Black Panther is stupid. Not every movie is going to be so perfect I need to see it in theaters three times.

But I’m also like, dream big. I still want it to be good. And Carol’s got Samuel L. Jackson by her side and he’s the biggest box office star of ever. And she may (depending on reviews and such) have more appeal overseas, like in China, which was notoriously a trouble spot for BP.

I myself am hoping for something closer to Thor: Ragnarok. (Which did about $800 worldwide.) What do you guys think?

reblog.comment:

I myself am hoping for something closer to Thor: Ragnarok. (Which did about $800 worldwide.) What do you guys think?

trail.content_raw:

And I agree that judging future superhero movies against the phenomenon that was Black Panther is stupid. Not every movie is going to be so perfect I need to see it in theaters three times.

But I’m also like, dream big. I still want it to be good. And Carol’s got Samuel L. Jackson by her side and he’s the biggest box office star of ever. And she may (depending on reviews and such) have more appeal overseas, like in China, which was notoriously a trouble spot for BP.

I myself am hoping for something closer to Thor: Ragnarok. (Which did about $800 worldwide.) What do you guys think?
trail.content:

And I agree that judging future superhero movies against the phenomenon that was Black Panther is stupid. Not every movie is going to be so perfect I need to see it in theaters three times.

But I’m also like, dream big. I still want it to be good. And Carol’s got Samuel L. Jackson by her side and he’s the biggest box office star of ever. And she may (depending on reviews and such) have more appeal overseas, like in China, which was notoriously a trouble spot for BP.

summary: You screwed up, Avengers. That's human. What is also human is the ability to learn from those mistakes. To grow. To mature. If...
caption:
You screwed up, Avengers. That’s human. What is also human is the ability to learn from those mistakes. To grow. To mature. If you do that, even a little, then perhaps what I went through will have a positive meaning. It’s your choice. 

Avengers Annual, Vol.1 #10

reblog.comment:

summary: PSA for people who use SJW as an insult
body:
PSA for people who use SJW as an insult

Don’t watch Captain Marvel. It’s not for you. Go ahead and stop reading comics too. SJWs aren’t ruining superheroes, SJWs invented superheroes.

summary: Captain Marvel Trailer Criticism Deemed Racist
title: Captain Marvel Trailer Criticism Deemed Racist
body:
Captain Marvel Trailer Criticism Deemed Racist

The Captain Marvel trailer dropped last week and the reaction to the film has been mixed. However, Zina at Stitch Media Mix, declared some of the trailer criticism is racist.

Zina’s ire at the Captain Marvel trailer criticism comes from Shakesville.com’s Melissa McEwan. McEwan criticized the trailer for pointing out Samuel L. Jackson’s Nick Fury has more lines than Brie Larson’s Captain Marvel.

View On WordPress

summary: CNBC Makes Wild Claim About Captain Marvel - Proves They Don't Know Anything About Marvel Universe!
title: CNBC Makes Wild Claim About Captain Marvel - Proves They Don't Know Anything About Marvel Universe!
body:
CNBC Makes Wild Claim About Captain Marvel – Proves They Don’t Know Anything About Marvel Universe!

CNBC made the absolutely ridiculous claim that Captain Marvel is “Marvel’s most powerful character ever.”

Now granted, they do use Kevin Feige’s words to back up this claim. He described Captain Marvel:

“She is more powerful than any character we’ve introduced thus far. So that alone tells you that there’s a reason Nick hit that button at the end [of Infinity War], when he realized that they were…

View On WordPress

blog.name: schmergo
blog.title: Schmerg The Impaler's Secret Laboratory
blog.description:
Schmergo, 26, Washington DC denizen, lover of literature, fan of fluffy cravats and falafel. 
Here there be lots of corny jokes, Shakespeare (especially Richard III and Julius Caesar), classic lit, Les Miserables, Hamilton, other musical theatre, Marvel, Game of Thrones, history, Harry Potter, Disney, and assorted other hijinks!

summary: I am seriously on the fence about  Carol Danvers. I’m sure she is a great comic book character with nuance and a good character...
title: I am seriously on the fence about  Carol Danvers. I’m sure she is a great comic book character with nuance and a good character arch and all that fun stuff. but I’m not making a decision about her until I’ve seen the movie.

reblog.comment: I think it’s only fair.

trail.content_raw: I think it’s only fair.
trail.content: I think it’s only fair.
